name: Steve Jobs
description: Co-founder of Apple Inc. who revolutionized personal computing, smartphones, and digital media. The iPhone transformed global communication and technology.

name: Bill Gates
description: Co-founder of Microsoft who dominated personal computer software revolution. Later became major philanthropist through Gates Foundation focusing on global health.

name: Elon Musk
description: Entrepreneur who founded/leads Tesla, SpaceX, and other ventures. Pioneered electric vehicles and private space exploration, controversial social media presence.

name: Jeff Bezos
description: Founded Amazon, transforming retail and cloud computing. Became world's wealthiest person; also founded Blue Origin space company.

name: Mark Zuckerberg
description: Founded Facebook (Meta), creating world's largest social network connecting billions. Controversies over privacy, misinformation, and social impact.

name: Jack Ma (馬雲)
description: Founded Alibaba, China's e-commerce giant. Became symbol of Chinese entrepreneurship before running afoul of government and retreating from public life.

name: Larry Page
description: Co-founded Google with Sergey Brin, creating world's dominant search engine and reshaping how humanity accesses information.

name: Sergey Brin
description: Co-founded Google with Larry Page. Born in Soviet Union, immigrated to US, helped create technologies that transformed the internet.

name: Barack Obama
description: First African-American US President (2009-2017). Passed Affordable Care Act, navigated 2008 financial crisis, authorized operation that killed Osama bin Laden.

name: Donald Trump
description: US President (2017-2021), businessman and media personality. Controversial presidency marked by trade wars, immigration policies, and two impeachments.

name: Angela Merkel
description: German Chancellor (2005-2021), longest-serving leader in modern European history. Led through eurozone crisis and refugee crisis, symbol of European stability.

name: Margaret Thatcher
description: First female British Prime Minister (1979-1990). Conservative leader who privatized industries, broke union power, and worked with Reagan to end Cold War.

name: Tony Blair
description: British Prime Minister (1997-2007) who modernized Labour Party. Legacy complicated by Iraq War involvement alongside George W. Bush.

name: Emmanuel Macron
description: French President (2017-present), youngest since Napoleon. Centrist reformer facing challenges from both left and right populism.

name: Vladimir Putin
description: Russian President/Prime Minister since 1999. Consolidated authoritarian control, annexed Crimea, invaded Ukraine, reasserted Russian power globally.

name: Xi Jinping (習近平)
description: Chinese President (2012-present) who consolidated power, eliminated term limits, intensified surveillance state, and pursued aggressive foreign policy.

name: Recep Tayyip Erdogan
description: Turkish President who transformed Turkey from parliamentary to presidential system. Increasingly authoritarian, expanded Turkish regional influence.

name: Narendra Modi
description: Indian Prime Minister (2014-present) who promoted Hindu nationalism and economic development. Controversial for religious tensions and democratic backsliding concerns.

name: Benjamin Netanyahu
description: Longest-serving Israeli Prime Minister. Dominated Israeli politics for decades, hardline on Palestinians, strengthened ties with Arab states.

name: Mikhail Gorbachev
description: Last Soviet leader whose glasnost and perestroika reforms led to end of Cold War and Soviet Union's collapse. Nobel Peace Prize winner.

name: Nelson Mandela
description: Anti-apartheid revolutionary who became South Africa's first Black president. Symbol of reconciliation and human rights, spent 27 years imprisoned.

name: Aung San Suu Kyi
description: Democracy activist who spent years under house arrest, won Nobel Peace Prize. Later led Myanmar government but legacy tarnished by Rohingya crisis.

name: Malala Yousafzai
description: Education activist who survived Taliban assassination attempt. Youngest Nobel Prize winner, advocates for girls' education worldwide.

name: Greta Thunberg
description: Youth climate activist who inspired global climate strikes. Symbol of young generation's climate activism and urgency.

name: Ai Weiwei (艾未未)
description: Artist and activist who challenges Chinese government through art. Imprisoned and exiled for political activism and human rights advocacy.

name: Desmond Tutu
description: Anglican archbishop and anti-apartheid activist. Led Truth and Reconciliation Commission, symbol of moral leadership and social justice.

name: Stephen Hawking
description: Theoretical physicist who revolutionized understanding of black holes and cosmology despite ALS. Made complex science accessible to public.

name: Tim Berners-Lee
description: Invented the World Wide Web in 1989, fundamentally transforming global communication, commerce, and information sharing.

name: Craig Venter
description: Led private effort to sequence human genome. Pioneer in synthetic biology and personalized medicine.

name: Tu Youyou (屠呦呦)
description: Discovered artemisinin for malaria treatment, saving millions of lives. First Chinese woman to win Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

name: Jennifer Doudna
description: Co-developed CRISPR gene editing technology, revolutionary tool for genetic engineering. Nobel Prize winner raising ethical questions about human genome editing.

name: Toni Morrison
description: Nobel Prize-winning novelist whose works explored African-American experience. Author of Beloved, Song of Solomon, and other masterworks.

name: Gabriel García Márquez
description: Nobel Prize-winning author of One Hundred Years of Solitude. Pioneer of magical realism, most influential Latin American writer of modern era.

name: Haruki Murakami (村上春樹)
description: Internationally acclaimed novelist blending surrealism with contemporary themes. Works like Norwegian Wood and 1Q84 achieved global popularity.

name: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
description: Acclaimed novelist and feminist voice. Author of Americanah and Half of a Yellow Sun, TED talk on feminism viewed millions of times.

name: Michael Jackson
description: King of Pop whose music, dance, and videos transformed popular culture globally. Thriller remains best-selling album ever, controversial personal life.

name: Beyoncé
description: Global superstar who transcended music to become cultural icon. Groundbreaking visual albums, powerful performances, advocate for Black culture and feminism.

name: Taylor Swift
description: One of best-selling music artists who evolved from country to pop to alternative. Cultural phenomenon with massive fanbase and industry influence.

name: BTS (K-pop group representative)
description: Global K-pop phenomenon that broke Western music barriers. Symbol of Korean Wave cultural influence worldwide, ARMY fanbase unprecedented in scale.

name: Steven Spielberg
description: Most commercially successful director in history. Created Jaws, E.T., Jurassic Park, Schindler's List, shaped modern blockbuster cinema.

name: Oprah Winfrey
description: Media mogul whose talk show dominated daytime TV. First Black female billionaire, influential philanthropist and cultural tastemaker.

name: Michael Jordan
description: Greatest basketball player who globalized NBA and transformed athlete branding. Six championships, cultural icon beyond sports.

name: Lionel Messi
description: Considered greatest footballer ever alongside Ronaldo. Won record Ballon d'Ors, led Argentina to World Cup victory in 2022.

name: Cristiano Ronaldo
description: Five-time Ballon d'Or winner, all-time top scorer in football history. Global brand transcending sport, rivalry with Messi defined an era.

name: Serena Williams
description: Dominant tennis player with 23 Grand Slam singles titles. Broke barriers as Black woman in tennis, advocate for equality and body positivity.

name: Usain Bolt
description: Fastest human ever, eight-time Olympic gold medalist. World records in 100m and 200m, transcended track and field as global personality.

name: Pope John Paul II
description: First non-Italian pope in 455 years whose 27-year papacy influenced collapse of communism. Traveled extensively, modernized Catholic Church outreach.

name: Pope Francis
description: First Latin American and Jesuit pope. Progressive on social issues, environmental advocate, emphasized mercy and inclusion over doctrine.

name: Dalai Lama (14th)
description: Spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism and symbol of Tibetan independence. Nobel Peace Prize winner, advocate for compassion and nonviolence in exile.
